text: Does anyone know the schedule of Diffractor.jl and when will it be released?

elements.text: Does anyone know the schedule of Diffractor.jl and when will it be released?

text: Not til sometimes after the optical closure PR is merged into Julia itself

elements.text: Not til sometimes after the optical closure PR is merged into Julia itself

text: I would guess sometime in next 6 months.

elements.text: I would guess sometime in next 6 months.

text:
I am not sure there even is a private Diffractor.jl repo.
I think is might be a scattered collection of scripts and proof of concept snippets

elements.text:

text: I had trouble using Zygote, so I looked up some information on Diffractor

elements.text: I had trouble using Zygote, so I looked up some information on Diffractor

text: it won't be generally usable until Julia v1.7 is released

elements.text: it won't be generally usable until Julia v1.7 is released

text: there will be earlier versions, and we plan to start testing it in SciML projects internally with alpha versions in like March or April. But I wouldn't expect most people to use it until way later. That timeline would be hard to guess, but maybe a GSoC summer push might be what it needs.

elements.text: there will be earlier versions, and we plan to start testing it in SciML projects internally with alpha versions in like March or April. But I wouldn't expect most people to use it until way later. That timeline would be hard to guess, but maybe a GSoC summer push might be what it needs.

text:
> I had trouble using Zygote, so I looked up some information on Diffractor

Diffractor won't be much easier to use than Zygote.
Mostly it will just be faster.
